docs.snippet: The center, Hope on Haven Hill, provides drug treatment and counseling in a safe environment for opioid users who are pregnant or newly postpartum.

headline.print_headline: New Mothers Derailed by Drugs Find Support in New Hampshire Home
headline.main: New Mothers Derailed by Drugs Find Support in New Hampshire Home

docs.abstract: Hope on Haven Hill in Rochester, NH, is residential drug treatment program for pregnant or newly postpartum women addicted to heroin, fentanyl and other opioids; federally and privately funded facility addresses state's high rate of babies born suffering withdrawal and other symptoms related to maternal drug use.

docs.snippet: Regulators are stuck in an outdated view of the world, while the internet giants are more attuned to the threat of nascent competitors.

headline.print_headline: Tech Giants Gobble Start-Ups in a Regulatory Blind Spot
headline.main: Tech Giants Gobble Start-Ups in an Antitrust Blind Spot

docs.abstract: Steven Davidoff Solomon Deal Professor column says Walmart's $3.3 billion bid for Jet.com, which is unlikely to receive objections from federal regulators, suggests antitrust system is out of date; argues that trend in which internet giants defensively acquire nascent startups to prevent competition will lead to continued dominance of just a very few companies.
